description.narrative: The development objective of the Second Power Sector Reform Development Policy Operation Program for Vietnam is to support the Government of Vietnam (GoV) in the design and implementation of a competitive market for electricity generation, restructuring of the power sector and reform of electricity tariffs that will facilitate effective competition, transparency and predictability to encourage generation investment, and to implement programs and incentives for efficient use of electricity. The GoV is implementing an ambitious power sector reform program to meet demand in a sustainable manner, deliver reliable and good quality electricity supply to support economic growth, while ensuring reasonable and fair revenues to investors and efficient and transparent costs to consumers. The expected outcomes of the reform program are the strengthening of electricity supply security and moving to efficient and competitive electricity prices. These outcomes are to be achieved through attracting a broader range of participants to invest in and modernize the management and operation of the electricity industry; and through the transition to electricity tariffs that, on the supply side, enable the financial viability of efficiently managed and operated companies, and on the demand side, provide pricing signals for the efficient use of electricity. The operation is consistent with the objectives of the new Country Partnership Strategy (CPS) between GoV and the World Bank for the period FY12-FY16. Linked to the CPS competitiveness pillar, it will contribute to improving economic management and business environment in the power sector, and improving the efficiency and quality of electricity infrastructure and services. Linked to the CPS sustainability pillar, the operation will contribute to climate change mitigation through tariff reform introducing efficient pricing and demand side r

title.narrative: Phase out of cross subsidy between different tariff categories.Indicators: level of cross subsidy from industrial and commercial categories reduced at least 50 percent; and subsidies targeted to poo

baseline.value: Cross subsidy of $370 million from industrial and commercial categories to residential category.Subsidies on first 100 kWh permonth provided to residential consumers supplied by EVN Power Companies

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Cross subsidy from industrial and commercial categories to residential consumersreduced to $185 million in 2012.Subsidies further focused on rural an

title.narrative: The independence and diversity of electricity generators increases, creating conditions that enable development of effective competition and allow the transition to wholesale competition.Indicator:

baseline.value: Highest proportion of generation owned by a single company is 70 percent.

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Highest proportion of generation owned by a single company is 40 percent.

title.narrative: Enhanced energy efficiency through legal framework, and adequate monitoring and enforcement mechanisms.Inidcator: energy efficiency target established by law, and MoIT and ERAV have capacity to enfo

baseline.value: No Energy Efficiency Law, and no formal demand side management obligations on Power Companies.

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Energy Efficiency Law sent to National Assembly by government.Demand sidemanagement obligations included in performance based ratemaking for Power Co

title.narrative: Annual tariff updates approved by MOIT up to 5 percent.Indicator: annual tariff adjustment is approved by March each year.

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Annual update approved in all intervening years between March 2010 and March 2012.

title.narrative: The System and Market Operator provides efficient and non discriminatory services following VCGM rules, codes and regulations.Indicator: audit by independent consultant firm determines compliance of

baseline.value: No audit (because there is no SMO).

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Audit demonstrates compliance and audit results published on web site to whichpublic has access.

title.narrative: Enhanced transparency in generation contracting and pricing, creating predictability for investors.Indicators: Single Buyer contracts coverage of generation and disclosure of spot market prices.

baseline.value: No contract coverage.No spot market disclosure.

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Contracts between Single Buyer and generators cover 90 percent of demand.Spotmarket prices disclosed on web site to which public has access.

title.narrative: Increase in generation availability due to market efficiency incentives improves reserve adequacy and supply security. Indicator: hourly operational reserve.

target.value: End of third operation in programmatic series:Ten percent hourly operational reserve.

title.narrative: Milestones for Policy Area D, Improving Demand Side Energy Efficiency:MoIT submits draft Energy Efficiency Law to Prime Minister.ERAV completes load research and drafts procedures for PCs' periodi

baseline.value: Draft Energy Efficiency Law not submitted.Load research program incomplete.

target.value: Draft Energy Efficiency Law submitted by MoIT to Prime Minister.Load research program complete and procedures drafted for PCs tocontinue.

title.narrative: Milestones for Policy Area A, Development of Competitive Market:ERAV completes draft Vietnam Competitive Generation Market (VCGM)Rules and submits to MoIT consultation and approval.MoIT issues Ci

baseline.value: No VCGM Rules draft submitted or Grid Code circular issued.

target.value: VCGM Rules draft submitted and Grid Code circular issued.

title.narrative: Milestones for Policy Area B, Power Sector Restructuring:EVN submits recommendations on independent generation companies to PrimeMinister.MoIT issues Circular on methodology and procedures to cal

baseline.value: No recommendation on independent generation companies submitted to Prime Minister.No Circular on System and Market Operator feesissued.

target.value: Recommendation on independent generation companies submitted.Circular on System and Market Operator fees issued.

title.narrative: Milestones for Policy Area C, Electricity Tariff Reform:Prime Minister Decision to promulgates Regulations on methodology to calculate and procedures for appraisal of market-based electricity prices

baseline.value: No regulations on methodology for market based prices.No proposal for transmission revenue requirement regulation.

target.value: Regulation on methodology for market based pricing issued.Transmission revenue requirement regulation submitted.
